description:
1. Create a VM 
2. Wait till active 
3. Attach a public ip to VM 
4. SSH to VM using nova ssh 
routray@ubuntu:~/Desktop/copy/st1$ nova ssh 
usage: nova ssh [--private] [--login <login>] <server> 
error: too few arguments 
Try `nova help ssh' for more information. 


routray@ubuntu:~/Desktop/copy/st1$ nova --debug ssh 106204 
connect: (cs.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net, 35357) 
send: 'POST /v2.0/tokens HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: cs.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net:35357\r\nContent-Length: 150\r\ncontent-type: application/json\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\naccept: application/json\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n{"auth": {"tenantName": "<email address hidden>", "passwordCredentials": {"username": "<email address hidden>", "password": "ca$hc0w!4#"}}}' 
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n' 
header: Content-Length: 3564 
header: Content-Type: application/json 
header: Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2012 10:29:28 GMT 
header: Cache-Control: no-cache 
header: Expires: -1 
header: Pragma: no-cache 
header: Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 
connect: (compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net, 443) 
send: u'GET /v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204 HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net\r\nx-auth-project-id: <email address hidden>\r\nx-auth-token: HPAuth_4f606bd1e4b0b829e4428dc9\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\naccept: application/json\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n' 
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n' 
header: Content-Length: 1015 
header: Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 
header: Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2012 10:29:32 GMT 
ERROR: No public address found. 

After little more debugging

I found that the public ip assigned is listed under private 

<snip>
RESP:{'date': 'Thu, 15 Mar 2012 07:17:00 GMT', 'status': '200', 'content-length': '1015', 'content-type': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8', 'content-location': u'https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204'} {"server": {"status": "ACTIVE", "updated": "2012-03-15T06:58:15Z", "hostId": "d303b97b5c36df3811814d8a707b22c219f622f88fb8ab397028e683", "user_id": "47101178638744", "name": "vm01", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/servers/106204", "rel": "bookmark"}], "addresses": {"private": [{"version": 4, "addr": "10.12.15.192"}, {"version": 4, "addr": "15.184.120.60"}]}, "tenant_id": "73438783064199", "image": {"id": "3172", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/images/3172", "rel": "bookmark"}]}, "created": "2012-03-14T10:15:12Z", "uuid": "c81949b6-dd1e-4993-ae4f-4c0e5b4225db", "accessIPv4": "", "accessIPv6": "", "key_name": "satya", "progress": 100, "flavor": {"id": "100", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/flavors/100", "rel": "bookmark"}]}, "config_drive": "", "id": 106204, "metadata": {}}} 
<snip> 

Might be this is the cause of this issue 

Guessing if we will have a public feild where the associated public ip will be located this issue may go away
title: No public IP addresses listed in server representation

comments.content:
1. Create a VM 
2. Wait till active 
3. Attach a public ip to VM 
4. SSH to VM using nova ssh 
routray@ubuntu:~/Desktop/copy/st1$ nova ssh 
usage: nova ssh [--private] [--login <login>] <server> 
error: too few arguments 
Try `nova help ssh' for more information. 


routray@ubuntu:~/Desktop/copy/st1$ nova --debug ssh 106204 
connect: (cs.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net, 35357) 
send: 'POST /v2.0/tokens HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: cs.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net:35357\r\nContent-Length: 150\r\ncontent-type: application/json\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\naccept: application/json\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n{"auth": {"tenantName": "<email address hidden>", "passwordCredentials": {"username": "<email address hidden>", "password": "ca$hc0w!4#"}}}' 
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n' 
header: Content-Length: 3564 
header: Content-Type: application/json 
header: Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2012 10:29:28 GMT 
header: Cache-Control: no-cache 
header: Expires: -1 
header: Pragma: no-cache 
header: Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1 
connect: (compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net, 443) 
send: u'GET /v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204 HTTP/1.1\r\nHost: compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net\r\nx-auth-project-id: <email address hidden>\r\nx-auth-token: HPAuth_4f606bd1e4b0b829e4428dc9\r\naccept-encoding: gzip, deflate\r\naccept: application/json\r\nuser-agent: python-novaclient\r\n\r\n' 
reply: 'HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n' 
header: Content-Length: 1015 
header: Content-Type: application/json; charset=UTF-8 
header: Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2012 10:29:32 GMT 
ERROR: No public address found. 

After little more debugging

I found that the public ip assigned is listed under private 

<snip>
RESP:{'date': 'Thu, 15 Mar 2012 07:17:00 GMT', 'status': '200', 'content-length': '1015', 'content-type': 'application/json; charset=UTF-8', 'content-location': u'https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204'} {"server": {"status": "ACTIVE", "updated": "2012-03-15T06:58:15Z", "hostId": "d303b97b5c36df3811814d8a707b22c219f622f88fb8ab397028e683", "user_id": "47101178638744", "name": "vm01", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/v1.1/73438783064199/servers/106204", "rel": "self"}, {"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/servers/106204", "rel": "bookmark"}], "addresses": {"private": [{"version": 4, "addr": "10.12.15.192"}, {"version": 4, "addr": "15.184.120.60"}]}, "tenant_id": "73438783064199", "image": {"id": "3172", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/images/3172", "rel": "bookmark"}]}, "created": "2012-03-14T10:15:12Z", "uuid": "c81949b6-dd1e-4993-ae4f-4c0e5b4225db", "accessIPv4": "", "accessIPv6": "", "key_name": "satya", "progress": 100, "flavor": {"id": "100", "links": [{"href": "https://compute.systest.aw1.hpcloud.net/73438783064199/flavors/100", "rel": "bookmark"}]}, "config_drive": "", "id": 106204, "metadata": {}}} 
<snip> 

Might be this is the cause of this issue 

Guessing if we will have a public feild where the associated public ip will be located this issue may go away
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~satya-routray-9

comments.content: What version of Nova is this tested against ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Looking at the code for 'nova ssh', it seems clear that it expects public addresses to be listed but we're only returning a private address:

  "addresses": {"private": [{"version": 4, "addr": "10.12.15.192"}
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content:
Actually, the public address is listed but it's not labeled:

{"version": 4, "addr": "15.184.120.60"}]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~gmi

comments.content: we don't need to fix this now, because of bp deprecate-nova-network.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wenjianhn

comments.content: I guess we can close this bug as per the above comment
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~satroutr

comments.content: Please feel free to reopen if the issue reoccured
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~satroutr

comments.content: Note that server ip address listing interface is a bit of a fiction as well as we also list all ip addresses as private through that interface too
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cyeoh-0

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/107027
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cyeoh-0

comments.content: I feel like this isn't really in progress, and I think it should wait until after we have the versioning mechanism in place to change this.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
I was able to reproduce this issue:

--------------------------------------
addresses: {
    private: [2]
        0:  {
            OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr: "fa:16:3e:7c:a5:51"
            version: 4
            addr: "10.0.1.4"
            OS-EXT-IPS:type: "fixed"
        }-
        1:  {
            OS-EXT-IPS-MAC:mac_addr: "fa:16:3e:7c:a5:51"
            version: 4
            addr: "172.24.4.4"
            OS-EXT-IPS:type: "floating"
        }-
---------------------------------------
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rh-s

comments.content: I am running on the latest code base (as of today).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rh-s

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Sean Dague (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/107027
Reason: This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Jenkins the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
This is an automated cleanup. This bug report has been closed because it
is older than 18 months and there is no open code change to fix this.
After this time it is unlikely that the circumstances which lead to
the observed issue can be reproduced.

If you can reproduce the bug, please:
* reopen the bug report (set to status "New")
* AND add the detailed steps to reproduce the issue (if applicable)
* AND leave a comment "CONFIRMED FOR: <RELEASE_NAME>"
  Only still supported release names are valid (LIBERTY, MITAKA, OCATA, NEWTON).
  Valid example: CONFIRMED FOR: LIBERTY
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller
